Bio

  • Bio
  • Informal Bio

I‚Äôm a Postdoctoral Researcher at the Singapore-MIT Alliance for Research and Technology, mentored by Siqi Zheng (MIT SUL) and Fabio Duarte (MIT SCL).

My research interests lie at the intersection of complex systems, data science, and urban economics. I integrate statistical and computational approaches‚Äîincluding network-based modeling, causal inference, and machine learning‚Äîto analyze large-scale human mobility data and explore how it informs sustainable and digital urban development.

In 2023, I received my Ph.D. in Data Science and Complex Networks from ETH Zurich, under the supervision of Frank Schweitzer (D-MTEC, Chair of Systems Design). Before that, I obtained my B.Sc. and M.Sc. in Physics ‚Äî focused on complex systems and statistical physics ‚Äî from Sapienza University of Rome, advised by Vittorio Loreto.

Hi there! I'm Ambra!

``Physicist in mind, data scientist in body, and social scientist in soul.''

In theory, I spend my days thinking up models and clever metrics. In practice, I spend them elbow-deep in messy data. Still, I love it ‚Äî data is my window to the world :)

When I‚Äôm not stress-testing my models, I ‚Äústress-test‚Äù myself with a lot of sports! Cycling, windsurfing, and hiking are my favorite ways to recharge, but I also love bouldering, skiing, inline skating, snorkeling, and many others. I rarely say no to an outdoor activity (unless I‚Äôm working, of course!).

I‚Äôm always gravitating toward new ideas, places, and cultures. Traveling fuels my curiosity and broadens my perspective. Together with science, it keeps my sense of wonder alive!
